attributes.action: Ban gambling and live odds advertising during sports broadcasts.
attributes.background: With the explosion of the Premier League, a similar and more sinister growth has taken place, that of online gambling. A gambling addiction can ruin families and lives and with smartphones accessible 24/7, it has never been easier to gamble.
attributes.additional_details: The government has banned smoking adverts yet betting companies are still allowed to advertise, with a 600% increase from 2006-2012 and children as young as 4 being exposed to 200 adverts a year. This creates a sense that gambling is part of life and everybody is doing it whereas in reality it can become dangerous. We are not asking for a ban on gambling, all we want is to separate the enjoyment of sport from the dangers of gambling, by banning gambling adverts during the broadcast of sport.

attributes.action: Charge the US for additional security measures needed for Donald Trumps UK Visit
attributes.background: Donald Trump will be making a state visit sometime soon, despite nearly 2 Million UK residents opposing it. The estimated cost of additional security for the visit is over £1Million- the U.K. Police forces / Tax Payers shouldn't be expected to foot this bill. The US should support the cost.
attributes.additional_details: Donald Trump will be making a state visit sometime soon, despite nearly 2 Million UK residents opposing it. The estimated cost of additional security for the visit is over £1Million- the U.K. Police forces / Tax Payers shouldn't be expected to foot this bill. The US should support / cover the cost. Our NHS is struggling, as are the other emergency services.

attributes.action: Don't jail journalists for publishing documents deemed harmful to the economy
attributes.background: Under new proposals for an Espionage Act to replace the Official Secrets Act journalists could be jailed for 14 years for obtaining or publishing anything that could be deemed harmful to our economy. This is against democracy, undermines journalism and its role of checking powers.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/02/11/journalists-obtain-leaked-official-material-could-sent-prison/

attributes.action: Make stolen motorcycle information freely available to the public.
attributes.background: Information pertaining to stolen powered two wheelers should be freely available. Registration numbers, VIN numbers and engine numbers of all vehicles reported stolen should be available on a free to use Government website with the aim of reducing theft by making stolen PTW's harder to sell.
attributes.additional_details: In the period Jan-15 to Mar-15, 6574 PTW's were reported as stolen (source www.met.police.uk/foi/pdfs/disclosure_2016/may_2016/2016030001373.pdf)  Many of these, especially in the London area have been used in robberies of individuals and shops.  As information on stolen PTW's is already available on pay to use sources, I would like to request that information held by Govt. agencies regarding theft status, colour changes and insurance history (e.g. write offs) be made freely available.

attributes.action: Referendum for the public to decide how the pension age should be set
attributes.background: The government has decided the pension age should be increased due to people living longer, the public have had no say in this so I would suggest a referendum to decide what a fair pensionable age would be in the U.K.

attributes.action: Stop variable speed limits on motorways
attributes.background: The cameras on motorways are just there to raise money not to stop accidents drivers spend more time watching there speed than driving and watching the road
attributes.additional_details: There are over 1000 speed camera fines issued per day bringing in millions for the country but doing nothing for road safety

attributes.action: Allow parents to use tax-free childcare vouchers to increase schools funding
attributes.background:
Schools funding in England is at a critical low - some are threatening a 4-day week to reduce the financial deficit.  This will profoundly affect our children's education.  
My local school receives just £15.16 per child per day.  It is not enough to cover even basic teaching requirements.
attributes.additional_details:
The idea:
Many working parents like me pay into a childcare voucher scheme for under-5s, where up to £243 per month can be used tax-free towards nursery.  
The government should extend this scheme so that is continues for working parents of over-5s and their schools. 
This means that if parents choose, and are able to make a voluntary financial donation to a school, it is not taxed; thus helping to fill the funding gap.

attributes.action: Increase inheritance tax to 95% on inheritance of assests or property.
attributes.background: Im really rich, but feel others should have a good opportunity in life too.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election to allow the British Public their say on Brexit
attributes.background: We've heard many politicians and much of the media insist that Brexit is a mandate for this or a mandate for that, but the only mandate the Government has is simply to 'Leave.' I propose we hold a General Election to unify the nation and give the public a chance to articulate what Brexit should mean
attributes.additional_details: We're on course to a Hard Brexit and straight into the arms of the USA and President Trump. This is not what we voted for. Many were swayed by the promise from prominent Leave campaigners that we'd receive an extra £350 million a week for the NHS. Even more powerful was the idea that we could 'Take Control' and 'Make Britain Great Again.' Without an election, the British Public are robbed of the control they were promised and denied the chance to play their bit to make Britain Great, again.

attributes.action: Petition to increase the lowest acceptable broadband speed from 2Mbps to 10Mbps
attributes.background: The Government definition of 'basic broadband' is 2Mbps. At 2Mbps many internet services do not work. Internet usage must be limited to 1 person per household and it is difficult to load the government's own HMRC site - making life difficult for SMEs and the self employed.
attributes.additional_details: From experience, I know it is easy for Openreach to achieve speeds of 2Mbps through the UK's existing infrastructure (predominantly still copper wiring from the 1950s/60s). If the lowest acceptable broadband speed is not increased to 10Mbps, Openreach will focus on improving broadband in built up, high profit areas - areas that largely already have good internet access. The 5G roll out plan typifies this. If the focus is not shifted, many areas will never receive a decent internet connection.

attributes.action: Protect non-resident parents with the introduction of a '3 strike' rule.
attributes.background: Parents awarded a residency / contact order should be held in check with a three strike rule that will revert residency to the other parent if they are deemed to be persistently violating an order, to prevent abuse, intimidation and instabilty for any children or adults involved.
attributes.additional_details:
http://theparentconnection.org.uk/articles/what-happens-if-a-former-partner-breaches-contact-order-arrangements

http://www.courtroomadvice.co.uk/breach-court-order-what-steps-take-next.html

This is intended to ensure that court orders made to the rights of the children are recognised by all parental / guardian parties, and not abused for the sake of intimidation, extortion, emotional blackmail or abuse.

attributes.action: Allow Tax Relief on Commuting to Work Costs
attributes.background:
Allow commuters to claim income tax relief on the cost of travelling to work. 
Commuters spend their own money to travel to work. Fuel & public transport costs rise and it costs more per year to get to work. 
▼More details
attributes.additional_details:
House prices force people out of areas & make more expensive commutes. Where workers live & where companies are located could be positively influenced by such a move.

If all workers had the opportunity to claim tax relief on their annual commute this would ease the housing market, create job mobility and employment in more regions. 
It is unfair, unreasonable & damaging to the mindset of all employees that they are taxed to go to work. It is an unfair burden on hard working people.

attributes.action: Return to the previous method of calculating Child Maintenance Payments.
attributes.background: The new Child Maintenance Service takes an estranged parents income direct from HMRC records.  This means that this now includes "income" listed on the HMRC listing that may be for benefit in kind taxation purposes and not be cash in a parents bank which is grossly unfair.
attributes.additional_details: Rt Hon Damien Green needs to order a review of the changes to return to the old method of calculating CSA payments from net income which is the only disposable income an estranged parent has control over.

attributes.action: Bigger fine instant ban for people who are caught driving while on the phone
attributes.background: I'm sure many of u like me are sick of seeing people texting or on the phone while driving, I for one think the new fines points etc is a complete joke. I see it on school runs right next to schools people texting or on their phone, enough is enough make it a instant ban and 5 grand fine

attributes.action: Stop serious offending criminals having the right to appeal their sentence
attributes.background: My dad was brutaly murdered by a man who was out on license after already serving a life sentence of 13 years.Once sentenced he tried to appeal.Luckily he didn't get to.Other victims families aren't so lucky and the criminals get early release.They're a danger and should not have the right to appeal

attributes.action: Make grooming awareness mandatory in all schools
attributes.background: This has recently happend in my area. And I feel all children need safeguarding training in this subject.

attributes.action: Improve the quality and amount of PE in schools and spend more on school dinners
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students at Greenwood Academy in Birmingham. We are campaigning to increase the amount of PE lessons in school and improve the quality of them in order to help get students healthier. We also feel school dinners lack the nutrition necessary to have healthier young people.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for parents to stop the other parent seeing their children
attributes.background: Some parents use children as a weapon to hurt the other parent. This is wrong in many ways and needs to stop. Let's get something done about it! Make it illegal for parents to do this without a court order or police recommendation

attributes.action: Save cyclists' lives by introducing 'The Dutch Reach' into the Driving Test
attributes.background: To simply and cheaply save cyclists' lives, we need to require a person to use their opposite hand to open a car door if they are to pass a driving test. This turns the body bringing passing cyclists into view.
attributes.additional_details:
This tiny change is called 'The Dutch Reach' as it is used in the Netherlands.  It saves people on bikes from being knocked into traffic when people open car doors. Using the opposite hand to open a car door forces the body to turn, so the driver sees the cyclist and fewer people are injured and killed on the roads. Such as this incident:

http://gu.com/p/5g79g?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other 

Video: see http://www.pri.org/stories/2016-09-27/easy-maneuver-borrowed-dutch-could-be-life-saving-cyclists

attributes.action: Have a referendum to approve a surcharge to all taxes for health & social care.
attributes.background: The main political parties are nervous of raising taxes for any purpose because of a possible election backlash. By holding a referendum, and assuming the answer is "yes", the party in government will have a mandate to raise taxation for this particular purpose.
attributes.additional_details: We are currently in a health and social care funding crisis. Local government has the responsibility but not the funds and in some case, the inclination, to support social care adequately. NHS trusts may be administratively inefficient and that has to be corrected but funding for the "sharp end" is inadequate and has to be corrected, and not by short term injections of funds.

attributes.action: Improve the treatment of asylum seekers and immigrants coming to the UK.
attributes.background: We believe that with help and support provided by the state asylum seekers and refugees can become just as much of as an asset to the UK. However, the treatment of these vulnerable individuals can only be changed through a shift in the Government's rhetoric and a change in British attitudes.
attributes.additional_details: Over the years the Government and the UK's attitudes towards asylum seekers and refugees have increasingly become more negative. The rhetoric that is pushed is one that pushes the idea of foreigners being somehow less valuable than those native to this country. We call on the Government to revisit and improve current policy.

attributes.action: Parliamentary Election To Take Place 3 Months After Brexit.
attributes.background: Brexit has had huge impact not only on the economy, but has been divisive to the nation/s... for many people both brexiteers and remainers many have lost a lot of faith in the government ability and do not feel the government can take us forward to unite us and recover the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Since Brexit, the countries division has been deep routed... And many people feel like their voices are not being heard. The government has been acting unilaterally ignoring a significant number of the population.

This has left very little confidence in the government's ability to fairly treat it's citizens. 

And the only way our voices will be heard is by holding a general election, to lead us in a positive direction and change.

attributes.action: Limit the public use of drones
attributes.background: We believe that the public use of drones is a very real threat to the public and to the community around you. For example there is very easy access to drones and could be used in the wrong way. For example planes have had near misses which could have caused potential threats to the passengers.
attributes.additional_details: I would like greater expansion and enforcement of drone no-fly areas better as serious threats can be caused.There have been cases where drones have been flown into prisons and where drones have been flown over major cities without authorisation which could be potentially life threatening for the public in light of the recent terror attacks in France and Paris. Terrorists could use this equipment. Islamic state already uses drones for surveillance missions and propaganda purposes.

attributes.action: Ban Strobe Lighting at Events like concerts etc
attributes.background: In the UK 1 in 103 people suffer from a form of epilepsy. Epileptics should be able to enjoy live music, films, shows, clubs etc. I am not asking for the occasional strobe to be banned but I am asking that excessive strobe lighting be banned.

attributes.action: Make all school 'inset days' during 'half term' periods, to save childcare cost.
attributes.background: Schools in the UK typically have 6 holiday periods per year. During this time, many parents need to pay for additional childcare or take time off work. In addition to this, schools also take many add hoc inset days (teacher training days). This training should be done during half term periods.
attributes.additional_details:
Schools doing their training during the half term periods, would save millions of parents time, money and inconvenience. It's extremely difficult for full time working parents to accommodate those ad hoc days, when the school is closed to pupils. 

The school building should be utilised during the half term periods for teacher training, as this is not only convenient for parents, but would be a better use of the school facilities, many of which are paid for with public tax money.

attributes.action: Move council tax non-payment months to Dec & Jan to help with winter fuel costs
attributes.background: On a 10 month direct debit plan, council tax isn't paid in April or May, please just change that to December and January to give everyone more money during the cold winter months to help with fuel costs and Christmas expenses.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government can make all councils do this by amending the Council Tax (Administration and Enforcement) Regulations 1992.

attributes.action: Install speed cameras along the A52 from Priory island to Bramcote island.
attributes.background: To many people are tragically losing their lives along this stretch of road as people see it as a race track, I propose that speed cameras are installed to deter and hopefully lower the number of deaths that occur on this road.
attributes.additional_details: After a tragic accident on the 25th November 2016 that killed 2 people because of dangerous driving, this could have been prevented with speed cameras.

attributes.action: Oblige UK banks to provide instant debit card cash deposits in the Post Office
attributes.background: The Banks’ closure programmes are unfair, particularly to their rural customers, personal & small business, and those who cannot travel far. The Government must oblige all UK banks to provide instant debit card cash deposit facilities via the Post Office as part of their branch closures programmes
attributes.additional_details:
Presently, just a few banks allow customers to deposit cash using their debit cards.
The bank closures are forcing personal & small business customers to deposit cash in a local Post office using the customer's paying-in slips, with delays of 2-3 days before crediting the customer's account: This is profitable to the banks to the cost of their customers.
This petition asks the Government to only allow future bank closures, if the bank has put actions in place to stop this unfair practice.

attributes.action: Stop phone  calling. Make it illegal to withhold a company phone number.
attributes.background: Anonymous phone calls, often 10 a day are causing great distress to many people especially the elderly. The telephone preference service does not work; companies either ignore it or say that we contacted them or showed interest when we did not. They are an unacceptable nuisance.

attributes.action: Increase funding for local authorities for Adult Social Care in England
attributes.background: The elderly should have the right to be entitled to remain in their own homes receiving a high standard of care with dignity and respect, until palliative care if required. This should include continuity of care & time to cover all tasks required for the individual with trained care assistants.
attributes.additional_details: I am a registered care manager for a leading care provider who offers the highest standards of care with highly trained and qualified staff. Every week we have customers with specialist needs I.E. dementia, who do not have the time allowed by our local authority due to financial restrictions, or choosing a low standard of care agency who are non compliant due to funding.  This has to stop. This should not be a financial lottery.

attributes.action: Make tractor drivers pass a HGV test due to to the weights tractors can now haul
attributes.background: Tractor tests have been very simple since the war, the machines themselves have got larger in comparison, the power and weight hauling capability has also increased, but the drivers exprience or knowledge has not. A tractor slid across a field with a near miss of children who were on adjacent land.

attributes.action: Make Makaton sign language part of the national curriculum and the EYFS
attributes.background: Makaton is a form of sign language used by many people with hearing or speech disabilities, if Makaton was taught from a young age signing would become as natural as learning your first language. If everyone could sign it would break down barriers, for people with disabilities and unite people.

attributes.action: Require the Cabinet ministers to have experience relevant to their roles.
attributes.background: In most public sector jobs the relevant Cabinet minister has little/no experience actually doing any of the jobs they oversee. It would give them more credibility if they have done the jobs in the sector that they're responsible for. eg.The minister for health should have worked in healthcare.

attributes.action: Find accommodation for all unaccompanied children stranded in  Calais Jungle
attributes.background:
1500 children stranded in containers and tents around the area known as the Jungle in Calais urgently need appropriate housing 
& support,
 To leave unaccompanied minors who have been left to fend for themselves  is immoral, unsafe and reckless.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/the-calais-jungle-has-become-like-lord-of-the-flies-with-1500-children-left-behind-in-containers-and-a7388021.html

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/calais-jungle-latest-refugee-children-unaccompanied-minors-camp-migrants-destroyed-relocated-moved-a7386551.html

attributes.action: The awareness of FGM (female genital mutilation) to increase in schools.
attributes.background: FGM is the practice of partially or totally removing the external genitalia. Until recently I had no idea what FGM was. i had no idea that girls all around the world could be suffering from FGM. When people explained it to me I was horrified.
attributes.additional_details: Due to this more awareness should be given to students. This could help stop the practice of FGM in this country completely. FGM is still a big problem here even though it is illegal.

attributes.action: Reinstate George Osborne's plan to set up a 2nd hand annuity market
attributes.background: People have been waiting nearly two years to be able to sell their poor monthly payments for cash lump sums where they can make a difference to their lives.   For example, I've sat with no working boiler as I can't afford one without my annuity funds in one payment.

attributes.action: Increase the number of specialist road traffic officers to reduce road deaths
attributes.background: 10,732 people died on UK roads between 2010 and 2015. In the period Jan to March 2016 alone saw a 14% increase in reported road deaths. Without the fear of detection, non-compliance of road safety rules and laws is noticeably increasing. Enforcement is no longer supporting education or engineering
attributes.additional_details:
"The level of enforcement on our roads is woefully inadequate, 
between 2010 and 2014 the UK has seen a 27% reduction in the number of specialist road traffic police on the roads (falling from 5,338 to 3,901) outside of London". Brake-the road safety charity
Without a visible police presence, road users no longer fear being caught and are increasing non-compliant and yet detection rates are falling
Between 2010-15 133,565 people were seriously injured
Motor insurers paid out £27m per day in 2015

attributes.action: The general election must be made a public holiday.
attributes.background: This will help increase voter turnout.

attributes.action: Prevent closure of Path House Mental Health Crisis Service in Ludlow.
attributes.background: The fundamental benefit of Path House is to offer guests a homely but therapeutic alternative to hospital admission as this is financially very costly and often vastly unnecessary or inappropriate for the individual; preferring a less extreme route to recovery.
attributes.additional_details: Shropshire CCG say that Path House would be better suited to a location in either Shrewsbury or North Shropshire as it is "under-occupied". It's our belief that Path's location in Ludlow is what makes it such a special and unique service, the town provides peace and calm and for the majority of our guests that come from larger towns; Ludlow offers the anonymity that guests largely benefit from. The location is only undesirable from the point of view of the CCG in terms of traveling the A49 for reviews and transporting guests. From our point of view and that of the guest; the location is what aids and improves recovery so that guests can return home sooner than they ordinarily would be able to.

attributes.action: Bring back the community care grant
attributes.background: Bring back the community care grant for people on little income
attributes.additional_details: People on low incomes need support and help living in the community disability mental health....

attributes.action: Half spending on Trident (and invest the saved money into healthcare).
attributes.background: While there may be valid reasons for the United Kingdom to possess a nuclear arsenal, the size of said arsenal is completely arbitrary due to mutually assured destruction, there is no reason the same benefits cannot be achieved with a greatly reduced nuclear arsenal.
attributes.additional_details: It is widely held that the fundamental truth of nuclear weapons is that they can never be used, furthermore by reducing the size of our nuclear arsenal we would be setting a precedent for other countries to do the same, in a time of growing tensions between nations we could be held up as an example to others, instead of another country making irrational paranoid policy decisions based on no evidence. The money can be invested in healthcare, a cause on which there is consensus across party lines

attributes.action: Allow courtesy light in personal vehicles when responding to emergency callouts.
attributes.background: Retained firefighters, lowland search & rescue, and lifeboat crew members all respond to emergency callouts in their personal vehicles, often tackling busy traffic. The use of a courtesy light could warn other motorist of an emergency response, which could be the difference in life or death.

attributes.action: Scotland must hold a referendum on whether to rerun the independence referendum.
attributes.background: The raisin d'etre of the Scottish Nationalist Party (SNP) is for an independent Scotland & so it's likely to repeatedly trigger Independence referenda until it gets this. It is crucial that such potentially destabilising referenda are only held when the majorIty of Scotts want them.
attributes.additional_details: The best way to prove that a majority of Sottish people want to hold a further independence referendum is to put this question to them at an initial referendum.

attributes.action: Give prison officers stab vests
attributes.background: British prisons are getting more and more dangerous and weapons like make-shift knives are sometimes used. Better prepare and protect prison officers by giving them stab vests.

attributes.action: UK Government to outlaw the building of homes on land contaminated by asbestos.
attributes.background: The Turner Brothers Asbestos plant in Rochdale was the world's foremost manufacturer of asbestos for 100 years. The land is contaminated. To build housing there would be of severe detriment to public health and the environment.

attributes.action: HGV stay in the inside lane between 6am to 8pm on motorways and dual carriageway
attributes.background: I feel a lot of the congestion caused is by one lorry overtaking another lorry and taking miles to do so , making lorries keep to the inside lane would ease a lot of this it would also save the government and the county a fortune as a lot of the road widening schemes would not be necessary ,

attributes.action: Mothers who are domestic abuse victims should rightfully gain custody of child
attributes.background: Are you a mother trying to protect your child and yourself from domestic abuse? Please sign this petition.
attributes.additional_details: Mothers who have become a victim of domestic abuse should have full parental responsibility over their children. And fathers' rights to visitation should be on the mother's terms to safeguard both mother and child from the most common outbursts, physical and emotional abuse and controlling demands.

attributes.action: Make Taxi Drivers require a black box
attributes.background: As a young driver, I myself have a black box and am personally limited to the speed I can travel at.Taxi drivers have the privilege to be able to drive in bus lanes and I am always seeing them driving past the speed limit. This is dangerous for everyone and increases the likelihood of an accident
attributes.additional_details: Once I was driving home travelling at 40mph in a 40 zone, and a taxi overtook me and came really close to hitting my car. The taxi driver was dropping off a customer on my road, and I confronted the taxi driver and asked why he was driving so close to my car and he said "because you were driving too slow". I told him that I had a black box and he said he understood, but then proceeded to tell me that in future I should let other people know that I have a black box by "using my hazard lights".

attributes.action: In the event of Scotland's independence all Government contracts be cancelled.
attributes.background: In recent years many vital services such as ship building has been moved to Scotland to assist in employment and local economy but at the expense of English towns and workers who have trained and been in their industries for many years.
attributes.additional_details: Portsmouth docks and ship building and repairs were moved to Scotland. Work that was originally carried out for repairs to Naval vessels in Woolston Southampton were withdrawn and now are carried out in Scotland.

attributes.action: Make 'name blind' recruitment a legal requirement
attributes.background:
The Equality Act 2010 made discrimination based on race, religion, gender, disability and sexual orientation illegal. 

Yet employers routinely discriminate against those with a foriegn sounding name on their cvs despite them having identical qualifications to other candidates. This must end now.
attributes.additional_details:
A recent BBC report stated that candidates with an ‘English-sounding name’ could be offered three times the number of interviews than an applicant with a Muslim name with the same qualifications.

Similarly, those with African or Caribbean sounding names are equally discriminated against as are women:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/38751307?client=ms-android-orange-gb. 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/34636464?client=ms-android-orange-gb.

This creates an unequal society for UK citizens.
